name: Keys to Drawing - Hand
desc: Based on Project 1-B of Keys to Drawing by Bert Dodson. Make a drawing of your own hand, with the hand and fingers pointed towards your eyes. Use line only - a sharp pencil, pen and ink, ballpoint, pen, or felt-tip market (fine point).

name: Keys to Drawing - Fruit
desc: Based on Project 1-C of Keys to Drawing by Bert Dodson. Draw a fruit entirely from memory. Then, grab a real fruit (like from APB), place it in front of you, and draw it while closely observing it.

name: Shoe/Bag Line Drawing
desc: Based on Project 1-A of Keys to Drawing by Bert Dodson. Make a drawing of your own crossed feet, stressing accurate contour and detail. Use line only - a sharp pencil, pen and ink, ballpoint, pen, or felt-tip market (fine point).

name: Still Life
desc: The still life should be pretty minimal, like a chair or a pair of glasses and a book or something, donâ€™t need to go all out and set up like 10 objects on a cloth

name: Blind Contour
desc: Pick a subject to draw. Draw the subject without looking at your paper.

name: Upside-Down Picasso Stravinsky
desc: Draw Picasso's portrait of Igor Stravinsky upside down. This exercise encourages people's visual thinking to take over, as people are not accustomed to seeing upside-down portraits.

name: Negative Space Exercise
desc: Pick a subject to draw, but draw the negative space around the object instead of the object itself.

name: Negative Space + Perspective
desc: Draw the negative space around the object, paying close attention to how the silhouette defines the perspective of the object.

name: Copy A Master
desc: Pick an art master, and copy their work. Think about what the master observed and noticed while creating the artwork.

name: 1-object Still Life
desc: Grab an object and draw it with lines and shading.

name: Proportion Copies
desc: Grab a human proportion sheet (you can find them online) and copy it down, noting the relative sizes between body parts.

name: Gesture Drawing
desc: Can get gesture references from online (like DrawThis Youtube channel), CFA figure drawing sessions if they are available, or just some people in public.

name: Croquis Drawing
desc: Like gesture drawing, but with an emphasis on the silhouette of the figure.

name: Boxes of Head-Torso-Hips + Spine
desc: Proko is good at explaining this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yqxPHew5bGQ&t=510s&ab_channel=Proko

name: Pick A Body Part To Study
3D Forms of Mannequins
desc: Grab an art mannequin or 3D model and copy down its forms.

name: Draw Figure From Different Perspective Than Shown
Line Exercises
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/4/homework.

name: Organic Perspective Exercise
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/organicperspective.

name: Rotated Boxes Exercise
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/rotatedboxes.

name: Ellipse Exercises
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/5/homework.

name: 2- and 3-Point Perspective
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/6/homework.

name: Divided and Rotating Planes in 2-Point Perspective
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/ghostedplanes.

name: 1-Point Perspective: Vanishing Points and Horizon Lines
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/roughperspective.

name: Cylinders, Spheres, and Cones
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/5/homework.

name: Shape Rotations, Intersections, Dissections
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/2/3/homework.

name: 2-Point Perspective, Rotation by Moving Vanishing Point
desc: Exercise descriptions can be found at https://drawabox.com/lesson/1/plottedperspective.

name: Draw A Car Or Something
desc: Draw a car using construction. be aware of the perspective of the car and the box shape the car takes up.

name: Robertson Perspective/Sculpting Techniques
desc: Examples of these techniques can be found at https://www.thegnomonworkshop.com/tutorials/basic-perspective-form-drawing.

name: "Art Telephone" of Sketch -> Lineart -> Colors -> Render Passes
Draw The Same Character From Memory
Draw Something From A Shindanmaker
desc: Shidanmaker link: https://en.shindanmaker.com/

name: Draw Something From A Random Picrew
desc: Picrew link: https://picrew.me/

name: Compositional Values Study
desc: Take a drawing or photograph and break down its values. Notice how the values contribute to the overall composition of the piece.

name: Same Scene At Different Times Of Day
Draw From Same Reference Multiple Times, 5min Each
desc: Exercise description can be found at https://youtu.be/reAPHAsQolE
